column2: WISCONSIN PERMIT TEST
column6: WI

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column6: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column8: watch for this species crossing the road.
column10: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 2. When merging onto an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: always stop before entering the highway.
column6: turn on their emergency flashers right before merging.
column8: select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.

column2: 3. When driving at night, drivers should:
column6: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.
column8: increase their following distance.

column2: 4. Tailgating:
column6: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.
column8: is a defensive driving tecnique.
column10: cannot result in a traffic citation.

column2: 5. Aggressive drivers:
column6: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.
column8: run stop signs.

column2: 6. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column6: using the inside rearview mirror.
column8: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.
column10: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.

column2: 7. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: is a no-right-turns sign.
column10: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Side road entering from the left
column6: Side road
column8: Yield sign ahead

column2: 9. This sign tells drivers:
column4: turning right on red is forbidden.
column6: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column8: they may not turn right or left during the red light.

column2: 10. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 11. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.
column6: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column8: apply the brake and slow down.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column6: Railroad Warning
column8: Crossroads ahead

column2: 13. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.
column6: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column8: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.

column2: 14. A defensive driver:
column4: never drives below the speed limit.
column6: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column8: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.

column2: 15. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 16. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column6: honk to let them know you’re there.
column8: yield.

column2: 17. Alcohol causes:
column6: loss of concentration.
column8: poor judgment.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column6: No U-Turn
column8: No right turn

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column6: Emergency stop ahead
column8: Traffic signal ahead
column10: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.

column2: 20. Yellow traffic signs:
column6: guide drivers.
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 21. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column6: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: to keep the front wheels straight.

column2: 22. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column6: Vertical rectangle
column8: Diamond

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: A steep grade is ahead
column8: A four-way intersection is ahead

column2: 24. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on residential and business streets is:
column6: 15 MPH
column8: 35 MPH

column2: 25. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column6: Time
column8: Taking a cold shower

column2: 26. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column8: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column10: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 27. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column6: taking a cold shower.
column8: not to drink over a period of time.

column2: 28. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column6: .10% or higher.
column8: .08% or higher.

column2: 29. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 30. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.
column6: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.
column8: you may not cross the broken white line.

column2: 31. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column6: On the crosswalk.
column8: Before the stop line.

column2: 32. Motorcycles:
column4: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.
column6: are easier to see than cars.
column8: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 33. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
column6: in any direction.
column8: parallel to the curb.

column2: 34. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column6: school crossings.
column8: dangerous intersections.

column2: 35. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a low place in the road.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column6: Low clearance
column8: Lane shifting

column2: 37. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column6: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.

column2: 38. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column6: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrians must not cross
column8: School zone ahead

column2: 40. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 41. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: stop doing what they are doing.
column10: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 42. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: always obey signs and traffic signals.
column6: expect trains on any track at any time.
column8: never drive around lowered crossing gates.

column2: 43. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
44. This sign indicates that:
column4: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column6: there is a school zone after the curve.
column8: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column10: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.

column2: 45. This sign indicates:
column6: Do not use your phone while driving
column8: Cell phone shop ahead

column2: 46. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column6: Better concentration
column8: Better reflexes

column2: 47. Which shape is a warning sign?
column6: Diamond
column8: Round

column2: 48. This road sign means:
column6: You are approaching a hill
column8: Road curves ahead

column2: 49. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column6: under no circumstances.
column8: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

column2: 50. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column6: Can help improve vehicle stability.
column8: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
